resources.string: This feature requires permission \"Usage Statistics\", it has to be manually enabled in Settings. \nOpen that Setting page?
When enabled, the filter only applies when both number and content match
The global switch, this app only works when this is turned on, a quick way to temporarily disable all the filters, turn it off when you are waiting for some particular call/message.

Permit if the call is repeated within a period of time, because repeated calls are less likely to be spams. Prior to other filters below.

It works by checking the history records in the app's database, so do not delete the history records too frequently, receiving text from the same number also counts.

The default setting "1 Time / 5 Min" means the second call within 5 minutes will be permitted.

When enabled, calls/texts from contacts are permitted.
When disabled, calls/texts will still be checked by other rules.

If you want to block all non-contact calls/texts, enable this and add a number rule: .*

Prior to other filters below.

Permitted any incoming call if any app in the list has been used recently.

A typical use case:
You ordered a pizza in PizzaApp, soon they call you to refund because they are closing. That call would pass if PizzaApp is enabled here. Prior to the filters below.

The default setting "5 Min" means any call will be permitted if any of those apps has been used within 5 minutes, by "used" it means being activated, or minimized, or killed.
Only works for calls, not for text messages, prior to the filter rules below.
These rules will apply to the phone number, the \"priority\" is ordered together with the \"Message Rules\" below.\n\nSwipe left to delete a rule.
These rules will apply to the text message, the \"priority\" is ordered together with the \"Number Rules\" above.\n\nSwipe left to delete a rule.

None: No notification at all. 
Shade: The dropdown notification shade. 
StatusBar: The small icon in the top bar.
Sound: The default notification sound.
Heads-Up: Popups a floating window on the top of the screen.

This helps to check if the rules are set as expected.

It's just a simulation and will not actually popup an incoming call(or text message).

The result is shown here, and in history log, with notification.
